title: Designing Advanced Mathematics Learning Using Flipped Classroom and Micro-Course Online Videos

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of full high school mathematics curriculum and foundational knowledge of college-level calculus
context.additional_context: Students watch pre-produced micro-lecture videos (5â€“7 minutes) before focusing on problem-solving and project collaboration in real-time classes. Project-based assessments measure the applicability of learning outcomes.

learning_goals: Students can self-study complex mathematical concepts through micro-course videos and explain core ideas.
Students can complete collaborative projects solving real-world problems (e.g., optimization, modeling) in a flipped classroom setting.
Students can present the process of applying concepts in online real-time classes and improve project outcomes by reflecting on feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
